title: HTTP Client & API Calls
subject: Angular
theory: Most front-end apps communicate with backend services over HTTP. Angular provides a simplified client HTTP API known as HttpClient, which rests on the XMLHTTPRequest interface exposed by browsers.

examples.explanation: HttpClient methods return Observables, not Promises.

common_mistakes.correction: Observables are lazy. The HTTP request is not sent until you call .subscribe().

interview_questions.question: Does HttpClient return a Promise or Observable?

real_world_use_cases.description: Sending login credentials via POST and receiving a token.

summary: HttpClient enables communication with remote servers using the Observable pattern.
